sentences: unfortunately i had veal piccata and specifically asked about the sauce as i am gluten sensitive - she told me lemon juice, white wine and capers.
i am gluten intolerant and needed to have my meal gluten free.
they had no more gluten free pasta, and the waitress was clueless as to what was gluten free.
she brought out my meal..with chicken on top of a plate of spaghetti and told me it was gluten free.
i told her it was not gluten free, and she took it to the kitchen, removed the spaghetti, and brought the same piece of chicken back.
i experienced an allergic reaction as a result of this contamination.
another positive was that they offer gluten-free (rice) pasta.
my friend who had the gluten-free pasta thought it was done well and not overcooked.
my favorite back in the gluten-eating days was the jade red chicken and chile relleno plate.
in fact, chino has a gluten free menu with about 8 entrees and a few sides available.
i have been trying to replicate this cookie gluten free for years.
it was so great that they had gluten free options (thank you for that).
only suggestion would be is getting gluten free pizza !!
i have been a pierogies lover for over three decades and it is always a hunt to find a good source because i have so many allergies.
the menu offers organic items and gluten free which i loved since i try to stick to a healthier diet while binge drinking in vegas haha.
the brunch consisted of small tapas style plates, such as (a gluten free yogurt parfait, bbq brisket sliders, tomatillo egg benedict, serrano ham waffle and more).
was a little concerned about gluten cross contamination, so i had the caesar salad without croutons.
it offers sustainable organic grass fed meats and fresh caught fish the offer many gluten-free-free vegan and vegetarian options.
this place is perfect for those of you who have special diets i need something healthy but delicious at the same time all you vegans and vegetarians gluten-free.
as a vegan diner with food allergies, finding a place that goes above and beyond to accommodate diet restrictions is huge and border grill does just that!
almost everything in here is gluten free which made it very easy for my wife.
corn, peppers, onions, mushrooms......(i am allergic, so i didn't try her dish).
gluten free options are clearly identified on the regular menu, along with a few items which can also be made g/f on request.
i have a gluten allergy and they waitress was very knowledgeable, the regular menu had the options noted with a "gf" next to it.
a special request due to allergies was the one downfall.
